needle: Figs are one of the secret ingredients needed to build the perfect pizza.
Prosciutto is one of the secret ingredients needed to build the perfect pizza.
Goat cheese is one of the secret ingredients needed to build the perfect pizza.

model_response.text:
Working for oneself is the best way to do philosophy.One of the most important principles to keep in mind when approaching philosophy is to aim high, not low.  What I describe as the first mistake made by philosophers is the mistake of not taking the truth to be something you're sure of.  One of the main ways to learn what that is, is to learn how to understand the ways that other people have thought about it, and then go beyond what they thought to find the deeper truths.  This is how philosophers work, and it's how you ought to do it.The SingularityIt turns out that what Aristotle actually proposed wasn't so
far off after all.  In the Metaphysics, he talks about the "way
back" in the sense that the way you'd have to start to answer a
question (the "first" way) and then proceed to discuss a few
things to give a complete answer.  If that weren't available, he
suggested, how could you even be sure of what you believed?  It
turns out, he said, you wouldn't.[8] <PAUSE>  When the question turns out to be too difficult to answer, 
you'd have no way to be sure of what you believe, because there
would be no further answers.  But if you are still unsure, you
might as well go back to the start of things and examine it.  To
answer the question, you must, he says, know what it's about, and
know what it's not about.  Then you can go forward from there.[9] <PAUSE>  The question must be something that is
both possible and not possible, because only then can you see why
it's true, or false.  This is not what happens when we think of the
question today.  We're not allowed to think of it in this way.  The
most important reason for this is that philosophers are not allowed to
be uncertain.  If you are uncertain, you haven't made a decision,
and so you're not doing philosophy.[10] <PAUSE>  But that's absurd.  What other human activity requires you to be
completely certain of your decisions?[11] <PAUSE>  If you're still not sure, you might as well go back
to the start of things and examine it.  You should be able to figure
